title: I'm a Picky Shopper, and These Under-$100 Finds Have My Approval
text:
Let me start by saying this is not your average, under-$100 roundup—I’ve spent hours making sure of that. Rather, these are the affordable finds that I wouldn’t just recommend to others but would actually wear myself. And, as some of you may already know, I’m extremely picky when it comes to that, but I like to think it’s a good thing for the most part.

So what should you expect below? Definitely a lot of basics as those are the backbones of simple-yet-cool style, not too much color but at least a few fun items, a sprinkling of trend pieces, and a handful of elegant accessories that look way more expensive than their price tags let on. If that all sounds satisfactory, which I hope it does, just keep scrolling to get started.

View photos

Mango Turtleneck Sweater ($80)

I'm very into layered-look sweaters right now and this Mango version is among my favorites.

View photos

Reformation Juliet High Straight Relaxed Jean ($98)

What more could you ask for in a fall jean?

View photos

Zara Animal Embossed Mini Crossbody Bag with Scarf Detail ($90)

Even from Zara, I would have guessed this bag was way more expensive.
description: Currently wondering how many I can actually buy.
